title: Top travel photos of the week
persons: David Ramos David Ramos Pablo Blazquez Dominguez John Schults Carsten Koall Shirlaine Forrest Shirlaine Forrest Shirlaine Forrest Jamal Saidi Dimitris Michalakis DIMITRIS MICHALAKIS MIKE BLAKE
KALNINS Pascal Le Segretain Pascal Le Segretain GLEB GARANICH Chris McGrath Chris McGrath Chris McGrath Peter Macdiarmid Peter Macdiarmid Jeff J Mitchell
text:
Top travel photos of the week Last updated 05:00, July 11 2015 David Ramos David Ramos Pablo Blazquez Dominguez John Schults Carsten Koall Shirlaine Forrest Shirlaine Forrest Shirlaine Forrest Jamal Saidi Dimitris Michalakis DIMITRIS MICHALAKIS MIKE BLAKE Reuters INTS KALNINS INTS KALNINS Pascal Le Segretain Pascal Le Segretain GLEB GARANICH Chris McGrath Chris McGrath Chris McGrath Peter Macdiarmid Peter Macdiarmid Jeff J Mitchell WPA Pool Dan Kitwood 
Revellers run with the Tajo and the Reina's fighting bulls on the third day of the San Fermin Running of the Bulls festival in Pamplona, Spain. The annual Fiesta de San Fermin, made famous by the 1926 novel of US writer Ernest Hemmingway entitled 'The Sun Also Rises', involves the daily running of the bulls through the historic heart of Pamplona to the bull ring. 
Revellers crowd together during the opening day or 'Chupinazo' of the San Fermin Running of the Bulls fiesta in Pamplona, Spain. 
People attend a mass during the second day of the San Fermin Running of the Bulls festival in Pamplona, Spain. 
A scuba diver makes his way out from from an underwater passageway at Isola Bella in Taormina, Italy, at the start of the summer holiday season. 
Women cool off in a water fountain in the landmark Lustgarten during a sweltering summer day in Berlin, Germany. 
Nearly 10,000 people took part in the Colour Run, dubbed the Happiest 5k on the Planet, at the Etihad Campus in Manchester. Starting the day as a blank canvas, participants followed a 5km course, getting covered in a different colour powder at each kilometre. The event is not timed and boasts an incredible party atmosphere, with participants treated to huge colour throws and music at the festival finish. 
Nearly 10,000 participants took part in the Colour Run, dubbed the Happiest 5k on the Planet, at the Etihad Campus in Manchester. 
Nearly 10,000 participants took part in the Colour Run, dubbed the Happiest 5k on the Planet, at the Etihad Campus in Manchester. 
Tourists visit Greek ruins in Faqra, Mount Lebanon. 
People enjoy the good weather at the beach of Elefsina, near Athens, Greece. 
People relax at the beach of Elefsina, near Athens, Greece. 
People sit on their cars as they watch Fourth of July fireworks from the San Diego County Fair in Solana Beach, California. 
Festival-goer Bibi from Germany gestures during Jamaican singer Barrington Levy's performance on the Orange Stage during the Roskilde Festival in Roskilde, Denmark. 
People swim near Murru prison, an abandoned Soviet prison, in Rummu quarry, Estonia. Under Soviet rule, Rummu quarry was used as a mining site for Vasalemma marble and most of the workforce involved detainees of Murru prison. When the prison closed, pumps that once kept the quarry and the prison dry were shut down, causing water to fill the quarry. It has become an unofficial and unguarded swimming and diving spot, attracting locals and tourists. 
A man jumps into water from the roof of Murru prison, an abandoned Soviet prison, in Rummu quarry, Estonia. 
Karlie Kloss models designs from Atelier Versace as part of Paris Fashion Week Haute Couture Fall/Winter 2015/2016 in France. 
A model walks the runway during the Elie Saab show as part of Paris Fashion Week Haute Couture Fall/Winter 2015/2016 in France. 
Men rest on a public beach near the Dnipro river as temperatures reached 32C in Kiev, Ukraine. 
A climber descends along a trail on Mt Fuji in Fujiyoshida, Japan. Mt Fuji is Japan's highest peak and was named a UNESCO Heritage site in 2013. Due to the popularity of climbing on Mt Fuji, concerns for the preservation of the area have forced local governments to look at ways to control visitor numbers. During peak season, between July and September, the summit trails on Mt Fuji are so congested with climbers they are close enough to touch. 
Climbers stop to take photographs along a trail to the summit of Mt Fuji in Japan. 
A man cleans a restroom at a mountain hut on the way to the summit of Mt Fuji, Japan. 
Lucha Libre wrestler El Hijo Del Santo, centre, poses with, from left, Cassius, Dr Wagner Jr, Metallico and Cassandro at York Hall in London, England. Lucha Libre, which translates as 'free fighting', is a Mexican style of wrestling where fighters enter the ring in flamboyant capes and outlandish suits, performing acrobatic moves and flying from spectacular heights. 
Mexican Lucha Libre wrestlers Dr Wagner Jr, Cassandro and El Hijo Del Santo pose at York Hall, England. 
The Kelpies sculptures are officially opened by Princess Anne and a flotilla of boats in Falkirk, Scotland. Sculptor Andy Scott also attended the opening, along with Duke, a Clydesdale horse that was one of the models for the 30m works, which have received more than one million visitors since they were completed in April 2014. 
Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, flip Welsh Cakes on hot plates as they tour the Village Bakery in Wrexham, Wales. 
Commuters queue at a bike hire point at Waterloo Station in London, England, during a strike by London Underground workers after management and unions failed to reach agreement over new night-time services. 1 of 26 
Here is our round up of the top travel photos from around the world. 
Do you have a favourite? Let us know in the comments.
